content.label: I wish this game was more expensive so I could give the developer more of my money. THAT'S HOW GOOD IT IS.

Plenty of fruit and food to be eaten here. Flowers too.

FMN looks plays and sounds like a pure genuine 80s arcade game most similar to Mr Do or Pacman. It's got more to it  with randomly generated levels, shooting, keys, potions multiple game modes and more. This keeps it very fresh and interesting. It's simple yet deep and very addictive.

The thing you won't find in other iOS games other than classic arcade ports is this forgotten balance of collecting food and avoiding bad guys the way FMN does it. I love it 

I was worried about the controls before playing it but I have to say it works fine. The character kind of has a slide to his turns so it works well with swiping. It won't be as good as an actual joystick of course but it's still so much fun.

It takes up very little space and I don't know if it's perfect but it might be one of the only games you need on your device if you can stand the retro style.
I can not put this game down. Actually I can but next thing you know I'm playing it again…

With about 15 seconds of trying this, I knew it was special.  Sometimes I am just right.

Retro, triply, cool, fun!

title.label: more depth than most retro arcade games

content.label: There's a lot going on in what appears to be a simple little game. The author clearly put effort into keeping the game fresh and surprising, even after dozens of plays.  Sometimes I fire it up for a quick play and run into something that I've never seen before, right there in the first level.

title.label: Pac-Man only wishes it was this good!

content.label:
UPDATE:  As of this update it only gets BETTER!  The new Seed mode lets all of the world's players play in the exact same set of levels for that day.  So now when you look at the day's top Seed scores you can't write off the tops scores as just getting lucky layouts.  The Arena mode is also neat since there is no easy way out.  You're trapped in this level for all eternity with beasties and flowers regenerating with each wave.  I love how you are really FORCED to get to know the random level the game has thrown together for you, for better or worse, if you want to survive long.

Wow!

This game is freaky fun!

Pac-Man with a gun in random mazes with a variety of enemies and a twisted take on power pills (there are none, you need to scrape against the walls to charge yourself up...but even then must be careful not to over charge or you might blow up).

Something also way too twisted in a good way is how the scoring from gathering pellets works.  No longer is it some silly 10 points per pellet but a clever progressive scoring based on how many pellets you're able to gather in a row without a break.  So, amidst all of the chaos of spawning baddies, you're trying to find a patch you can take through the maze that will have you gathering as many pellets as possible in an unbroken run.  The points gathered this way can be massive!  Pickup some 4 pellets in a row and get 16 points, but collect half the maze in one continuous run and you could be looking at 4,000 points or more (the points from the run are added until you end the current run).

This game is an interesting classic style game. The graphics are beautifully simple, as are the controls. The sounds are perfect :)

Cons:

•Needs achievements.

•Ugly icon! With such cool graphics, why is the icon so unlike the game graphics?

•More lives! I just started, but I don't think I'll be getting any more than 3 lives. Maybe an extra starting life every 10,000 flowers collected?

Thank you for making this game!!!
so much fun! great retro style!

title.label: Hands down one of the best games in the AppStore

content.label: New game modes are excellent.  FMN continues to be one of my favorites.

title.label: One of my all time fav iPhone games

content.label: I never write reviews but want to say how much I like this game. The sounds are amazing! So cool... Sometimes I like to play just to hear the cool old synth sounds. The gameplay is great also. I wish this was available as a arcade PCB so I could put it in my arcade cab. Thanks for this game!

forget.me.not crashes.a.lot

Needs better saving, I've lost so many games!

Fun title that has variety and requires more strategy than you would expect at first glance.  The retro style is well done and the control scheme works well once you get accustomed to it. 

My only gripe is that the sound stopped working after I received a call mid-game.  Sound works fine with everything else.   Suggestions for a fix other than "reinstall"?
It's like pac-man and Mr Do wrapped into one yet still is original. I can see this occupying a lot of my time.
Flat out amazing. Challenging, fascinating, engaging. A definite must own game.
LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT its like a newage pac man XDD and its retro
This is one of the few iOS games I've continued to come back to after months. A great blend of action and simplicity.
That's the game in a nutshell. Absolutely fantastic
Retro? Check! A total blast? Check! This is how I'll waste my time for quite a while now.  :)

title.label: My favorite iOS game by far

content.label: A hybrid of pacman and a roguelike in a package that feels totally original, yet reminiscent of the arcade games of old.  I play this game at least once a day and try to top my previous high scores. Thank you for making this lovely, delightful, polished game!

title.label: Dope little Pac-Man style arcade game.

content.label: With cool sound FX, and addictive gameplay, it's a must have. Dope.
Super addictive game

title.label: Love it after playing a few times

content.label:
Of all the games I have this is the one that i keep coming back to. The first few times I played it I was not sure but then it sucked it me in, now I just want to keep playing. The levels are always different so each time is something new. I have never had this game crash on my iPad or iPhone 4 so I am not sure why someone reporting it crashing.

Over all this is a game that will hook you if you give it a chance.

ingeniously simple and incredibly fun, a mix that's hard to come by these days. Much better than any pacman iteration (thanks to rpg 'progression' elements), has a very unique feel to it, every floor comes to life as enemies start to wander around and try to beat down...not only you but other enemies too! Maybe the best pick-and-play game on the appstore, 5 blazing stars hugely deserved!
Amalgamation of retro games, good execution, but a tired, boring concept.

This game is seriously awesome. It's got that haunting, echoey sound design that would kinda freak me out as a kid. I have no idea if it's possible, but if you added support for the upcoming iCade it'd make for the perfect retro experience.
Really brings back the feel of an '80s arcade game. Great design, and controls surprisingly well. Outstanding replayability, lots of fun.

THIS GAME DESERVES IT'S OWN ARCADE BOOTH WITH A JOYSTICK. IT IS THAT GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

BEST GAME I'VE PLAYED IN YEARS

I just need to stress that this is my favorite game of oodles of games on my iPhone. I have never been so floored by, so stuck on a game. A perfect amalgamation of my love for new age and retro gaming. I've been sharing this with all my gaming friends, and I love watching their eyes bug out.
Good game just missing Achivements!
Perfectly nostalgic. Fun and quirky. A must-buy.

title.label: Interesting, but could use some work

content.label:
This is an interesting game with a lot of potential, but there are a couple of interface issues which mar the experience on the iPhone version. The bonus indicator when you finish a chain or pick up certain types of fruit is very difficult to see due it it's small size and dark color- it might work better if it were brighter or appeared under the 'score' indicator instead of on the maze itself. The swipe controls don't feel as sensitive as they need to be for a game like this, either; I hate to say it, but an onscreen D-pad might work better.

I very much like the idea of the randomly generated mazes, but because of the exponential nature or scoring, it feels a bit like your score depends largely on how big the mazes generated are and where you start out- big mazes produce higher scores due to the higher number of flowers, and a maze where it's convenient to chain flowers will score significantly higher than one where it isn't.

Still, it feels like something that will be great fun after a few updates- I'm definitely keeping an eye on this one!

- HC

title.label: Great retro game with some cool mechanics

content.label:
Just a couple of requests!

1) Bestiary of some sort

2) OS X version!

title.label: old school graphics(pac man) and shooter

content.label: it's just like hte old but popular game-pacman, butwith a little twist-shooting, it's very fun and challenging to play, overall, it's a great game
This game is so good! I'm loving the old school graphics and sounds! I really like how the levels are random too!

This game is perfect for those retro gaming lovers. I would like to see further updates with more gamecenter support (achievments) and more level elements to spice things up. Overall this is a must buy and is worth the price.
This game is really good, way better than 90% of ios games out there. Who knew such a bizarre ruleset could result in such enjoyable gameplay?
A very enjoyable game

Rocketcat games sent me and it looks super fun but I have 1st gen itouch and it doesn't work;(
But :) the developer said he's working on a fix so yay!

I have been a fan of nyarlu labs since 2006, back when I uploaded Magnetic Shaving Derby to my Nintendo DS flash card. I have fond memories of playing it and thinking it was the best homebrew game for the DS.

But along came the iPhone and indie game development exploded. I was happy to see Magnetic Shaving Derby show up on the app store with a makeover and felt thrilled that the developer was still making games and standing out from the crowd much like he did with the DS.

Now along comes Forget Me Not and wow.  I am now a lifelong supporter of Nyarlu Labs.  This game is amazing.  Lots of talent and programming knowledge went into this game.  Thank you.

Folks, don't let the simplistic screen shots throw you off. THIS little gem houses a TON of addictive, varied, and extremely entertaining game-play. Something that simply can not be said about 90% of the games on any format including ios. Yes  it has a maze and yes you collect dots (flowers), but that's where its relation to Pac-Man ends. Your character shoots in the direction he travels, and many enemies do the same. . There are goodies to collect like heal potions, keys, etc.. and a variety  of monsters which have different personalities. Some may be harder to kill, others go out with a bang, taking down chunks of the maze and sometimes even kill each other!  New levels introduce new dangers and more intricate mazes. The visuals are pure retro  - but done so stylishly .. they actually look much better on an iPad then the screen shots shown above. I love the crazy retro sound effects  - which adds a lot to the game! 

In a nutshell - this will be played LONG after games like Dead Space and Infinity Blade are put to rest in ios folders.
I suggest buying it

title.label: It's amazing how little you have to add to pac-man to make it awesome.

content.label: Ok. Take pac-man, add randomized, destructible levels, screen wrapping, bullets, and infinitely spawning enemies and you get a game that I have spent far too much time on. On a surface level, it seems to be a ridiculously simple game (and, well, it really is), but when you really get into the game you realize the amount of strategic depth these new additions add to the classic (and, in my opinion, stale) formula. And it's half the price of pac-man (because NAMCO, like all big publishers, doesn't understand how downloadable titles work). I truly cannot recommend this game enough.

title.label: Fun game, but control could be better

content.label: This is a great little game that reminds me of Crossroads II for the C64 quite a bit. My one complaint is that the swipe control is somewhat cumbersome for making quick maneuvers. Personally, I'd prefer the standard on-screen D-pad and fire button. Other than that, it's great fun.
Yup

As others have said, this is absolute 8 bit goodness of several different genres. The scoring system encourages you to take risks and the number of different monsters is amazing. Only complaint is that the swipe controls seem imprecise at times but perhaps I just need more practice...
I wouldn't complain about more control options (tilt would be interesting) but other than that this is fantastic. Music would be nice too but there's already plenty going on sound-wise. Great game!

This is fun game that takes the tried and true pac man formula and adds some new idea from other games like Gauntlet and Rogue.  I would have given it 5 stars if it had a optional controls instead of just a swipe.

Lovely title that reminds me of old days on the 8-bit computer.  Great chunky sound effects and pixel art.  I kept seeing new baddies up until I stopped playing.  I look forward to further sessions with it.  I played it on my 1st gen iPad.  It worked fine, despite what Mr. OneStar says.
It's all about the sound!
I spent many quarters back in the day on pac-man and centipede. This is a great mash up of both games. Love it!
